section.title: Shared Meaning
section.description: Inspiration for making productive meaning in challenging times.

gems.text:
https://futurescouts.cc/ 
Future Scouts (est. 2016) is an international decentralized scouting organization for 21st century learners of all ages and genders. We create experiences, invent tools and develop technologies that help youngsters, teens and adults become self-directed, lifelong learners.

metalink.description: The Future Scouts offer an international learning program, the Future Scouts App & the Future Scouts Handbook of 21st Century Survival Skills.
metalink.title: Future Scouts International learning program, Social App and Handbook

metalink.description: ONE OF BARACK OBAMA’S FAVORITE BOOKS OF THE YEAR “The best science-fiction nonfiction novel I’ve ever read.” --Jonathan Lethem “If I could get policymakers, and citizens, everywhere to read just one book this year, it would be Kim Stanley Robinson’s The Ministry for the Future.” --Ezra Klein (…
metalink.title: The Ministry for the Future

gems.text:
[Book] The Collapse of Complex Societies, By Joseph Tainter (1988)

Recommended reading from conversation in Future Thinkers Podcast, Oct 16, 2017, Daniel Schmachtenberger - The Existential Game



https://www.google.com/books/edition/The_Collapse_of_Complex_Societies/YdW5wSPJXIoC?hl=en&gbpv=0

metalink.description: Political disintegration is a persistent feature of world history. The Collapse of Complex Societies, though written by an archaeologist, will therefore strike a chord throughout the social sciences. Any explanation of societal collapse carries lessons not just for the study of ancient societies, bu…
metalink.title: The Collapse of Complex Societies

gems.text:
[Book] Finite and Infinite Games, By James Carse · 2013
Reccommended reading from Daniel Schmachtenberger, from conversation Future Thinkers Podcast, Oct 16, 2017, Daniel Schmachtenberger - The Existential Game

This is a great introduction into wondering what a world beyond game theory looks like. It short. 

https://www.google.com/books/edition/_/s_pxNAEACAAJ?sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwikrua8ovj1AhWfknIEHY4EDB0Qre8FegQIKBAd

metalink.description: “There are at least two kinds of games,” states James P. Carse as he begins this extraordinary book. “One could be called finite; the other infinite. A finite game is played for the purpose of winning, an infinite game for the purpose of continuing the play.”Finite games are the familiar contests of…
metalink.title: Finite and Infinite Games
